title: Thunder Make Their Case as the Greatest Defensive Team of All Time
text:
The 2024-2025 Oklahoma City Thunder weren’t only elite on defense. They played defense like they were mad just seeing the other side try to score. This wasn’t no small improvement. This wasn’t “young team taking a step.” This was a working setup that shook things up in history. Yet when the season wrapped, just one thing kept resurfacing:
Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words.
Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words. Word words words words words.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(wehoop)
library(ggrepel)
library(waffle)



turnovers <- read_csv("Turnovers forced per game in the NBA - Sheet1.csv")

turnovers2024 <- turnovers |>
  select(Team, "2024")

OKC <- turnovers |>
  filter(
    Team == "Okla City"
  )

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=turnovers2024, aes(x=reorder(Team,`2024`), weight= `2024`), fill="lightgrey") +
  geom_bar(data=OKC, aes(x=reorder(Team, `2024`), weight= `2024`), fill="blue")  +
  coord_flip() +
    theme_minimal() +
labs(
    x="", 
    y="Turnovers forced per game", 
    title="Thunder were good against the bad, but elite against the great", 
    subtitle="The leagues turnovers forced per game were quite impressive with Thunder among the elite in the sport.", 
    caption="Source: Sports Reference | By Trey Stevens"
    ) +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 14, face = "bold"),
  axis.title = element_text(size = 10), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  plot.title.position = "plot"
    )

tov <- read_csv("tovrank(in).csv")

tov |> 
  select(RANK, TEAM, SEASON, `OPP TOV`) |>
  gt()|>
 cols_label(
    RANK = "Rank",
    TEAM = "Team",
    SEASON = "Season",
    `OPP TOV` = "Opponent Turnovers",
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "Does Nebraska have a chance to be special this season?",
    subtitle = "Amy Williams' team is near the middle of a tough conference where it matters most."
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) |>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Trey Stevens  |  **Source:** wehoop: The SportsDataverse's R Package for Women's Basketball Data")
  ) |>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none") |>
 
  data_color(
    columns = vars(`OPP TOV`),
    colors = scales::col_numeric(
      palette = c(
        "white", "orange", "red"),
      domain = NULL)
  )
